meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Digg, pictures, technology, breaking news, entertainment, politics, headline news, celebrity news, offbeat, world business, sports, funny videos

meta.content: The most interesting and talked about stories, videos and pictures on the web. Breaking news on Technology, Politics, Entertainment, and more!

meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: NOT AN APP FOR THAT... YET
A woman says the battery in her iPhone suddenly overheated this week, oozing a dark liquid and destroying the phone. Apple, however, is refusing to replace the phone.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ypus4C&via=Digg&text=iPhone Inferno?

div.a: IBM Security Tool Can Flag ‘Disgruntled Employees’

div.div: A new International Business Machines Corp. security tool uses Big Data to help CIOs detect internal and external security threats in new ways—and can even scan email and social media to flag apparently “disgruntled” employees who might be inclined to reveal company secrets.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14v7qxo&via=Digg&text=IBM Security Tool Can Flag ‘Disgruntled Employees’

div.a: The World’s Most Depressing Tech Infographic Says You’re Dead In 9 Years

div.div: Subtract all the eating, sleeping, working, and chores, and you’re practically dead already.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14ub49P&via=Digg&text=The World’s Most Depressing Tech Infographic Says You’re Dead In 9 Years

div.a: 10 Animals That Were Hunted To Extinction

div.div: Animals face many natural threats, including changing temperatures, predators, and unexpected disasters. But no external stresses have proved more destructive to the survival of other living things than man.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UKj7fU&via=Digg&text=10 Animals That Were Hunted To Extinction

div.div: THAT'S WHY BRITNEY SPEARS DID IT

div.a: Japanese Pop Idol Shaves Head, Tearily Apologizes For Dating

div.div: A shaved head and public shaming is the penance for a Japanese pop star recently discovered to have been spending some alone time in the apartment of a backup dancer from another group.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W800eR&via=Digg&text=Japanese Pop Idol Shaves Head, Tearily Apologizes For Dating

div.a: Man Spends 7 Years Drawing Incredibly Intricate Maze

div.div: Almost 30 years ago a Japanese custodian sat in front of a large A1 size sheet of white paper, whipped out a pen and started drawing the beginnings of diabolically complex maze, each twist and turn springing spontaneously from his brain onto the paper without aid of a computer.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XnIQZQ&via=Digg&text=Man Spends 7 Years Drawing Incredibly Intricate Maze

div.div: CRITICISM FROM A COLLEGE DROP OUT

div.a: Bill Gates Says There Is Something Perverse In College Ratings

div.div: There is a perverse metric rating system for U.S. colleges, says Bill Gates, the world’s most generous and influential philanthropist. The problem is that it gives credit to schools that attract the best students rather than schools that take poorly prepared students and help them get ready for the next stage.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WAKrh2&via=Digg&text=Bill Gates Says There Is Something Perverse In College Ratings

div.div: When you are trying to catch an 11-story-high wall of water moving at highway speeds, you can’t exactly use a measuring tape to check the wave’s height.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U7OCmf&via=Digg&text=How To Measure A 111-Foot Wave

div.a: The Enforced Happiness Of Pret A Manger

div.div: Pret keeps its sales clerks in a state of enforced rapture through policies vaguely reminiscent of the old East German Stasi. A "mystery shopper" visits every Pret outlet once a week. If the employee who rings up the sale is appropriately ebullient, then everyone in the shop gets a bonus. If not, nobody does.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/110tkK9&via=Digg&text=The Enforced Happiness Of Pret A Manger

div.a: The States With The Most Illegal Immigrants

div.div: A map of estimated illegal immigrant population, state by state.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W7abjC&via=Digg&text=The States With The Most Illegal Immigrants

div.a: Is Iran's Space Monkey A Fake?

div.div: Iran’s triumphant claim that it successfully sent a monkey into space may have been nothing more than hot air.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WFJy3Q&via=Digg&text=Is Iran's Space Monkey A Fake?

div.a: Incredible Images Show Huge Saturn Storm Destroy Itself By Eating Its Own Tail

div.div: One of the largest storms ever seen on Saturn may have been a victim of its own success, choking when it ate its own tail.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/W3pGJz&via=Digg&text=Incredible Images Show Huge Saturn Storm Destroy Itself By Eating Its Own Tail

div.div: WHAT GOES ON IN YOUR MIND

div.a: First-Ever Incredible Footage Of A Thought Being Formed

div.div: A team of Japanese researchers has achieved something incredible: they've captured, for the first time ever, a movie which shows how thoughts form in the brain.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Vzp2XK&via=Digg&text=First-Ever Incredible Footage Of A Thought Being Formed

div.a: Inside The Most Notorious Biker Gang

div.div: A Canadian bar bouncer became a millionaire-police agent by infiltrating the world’s most notorious biker gang: The Hells Angels.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YneaJn&via=Digg&text=Inside The Most Notorious Biker Gang

div.div: BECAUSE THE FBI IS SCARED OF YOUTUBE

div.a: Why Is Anonymous's Spokesman Facing 100 Years In Prison?

div.div: Barrett Brown was not a hacker. He did not infiltrate any systems, nor did he appear to know how to do anything of the sort. Barrett was an investigative journalist whose written for reputable publications. He closely aligned himself with Anonymous, and dug into some very serious, complicated, and high-level issues pertaining to the future of America’s cyberwar conquests.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XNwqc6&via=Digg&text=Why Is Anonymous's Spokesman Facing 100 Years In Prison?

div.a: 7th Grade Girls Send Hello Kitty To The Edge Of Space, Make Cool Video

div.div: 7the graders at Cornerstone Christian school performed this experiment on “the effects of altitude on air pressure and temperature.” And presumably also on a Hello Kitty doll inside a lovingly spray-painted rocket ship.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WYru66&via=Digg&text=7th Grade Girls Send Hello Kitty To The Edge Of Space, Make Cool Video

div.a: Should People Be Off On Fridays?

div.div: The Gambia has shortened the work week, making Friday a day of rest. Is this the perfect pattern for a working week?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12dyd1B&via=Digg&text=Should People Be Off On Fridays?

div.a: Man Finds Rare Chunk Of Sperm Whale 'Vomit' Worth Up To $180,000

div.div: The rare, waxy substance is believed to originate in the digestive tracts of sperm whales. Ambergris is highly valued by perfumers as a fixative and can fetch tidy sums.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WE9MDN&via=Digg&text=Man Finds Rare Chunk Of Sperm Whale 'Vomit' Worth Up To $180,000

div.div: Dispatches from a conference celebrating the Man of Steel's 75th birthday.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wk0osF&via=Digg&text=Is Superman Jewish?

div.a: This Is What New York Would Look Like With A Full Starry Sky

div.div: What would New York or Shanghai look like with a full sky of brilliant stars? Thierry Cohen, a French photographer, thinks he can show us by blending city scenes — shot and altered to eliminate lights and other distractions — and the night skies from less populated locations that fall on the same latitudes.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11d8WW2&via=Digg&text=This Is What New York Would Look Like With A Full Starry Sky

div.div: Modern-day science has little room for the likes of Galileo, who first used the telescope to study the sky, or Charles Darwin, who put forward the theory of evolution, argues a psychologist and expert in scientific genius.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11ozUZX&via=Digg&text=Is Scientific Genius Extinct?

div.div: WE ALL WANT THE LITTLE BLUE CHECK

div.a: Bogus Twitter Account Promises Verification, Snags 22,000 Hopeful Followers

div.div: Twitter has shut down the fake @privateverified, but not before thousands of users were duped.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/14DvFcQ&via=Digg&text=Bogus Twitter Account Promises Verification, Snags 22,000 Hopeful Followers

div.a: Google Street View Catches Couple Going At It In A Dressing Room

div.div: When not capturing guns being pointed at it or going on death-defying treks of the Grand Canyon, the Google street view team occasionally snaps things that are slightly sexier.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WH1XjC&via=Digg&text=Google Street View Catches Couple Going At It In A Dressing Room

div.a: The Quotable Ed Koch: Wit, Wisdom, And One-Liners

div.div: Ed "Quintessential New Yorker" Koch had a wonderfully big mouth. His catchphrase as mayor — "How'm I doin'?" — was only the beginning of his verbal gems.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WFudA5&via=Digg&text=The Quotable Ed Koch: Wit, Wisdom, And One-Liners

div.a: This Is How Your Brain Works

div.div: Ever wonder how your brain processes information? These brain tricks and illusions help to demonstrate the two main systems of Fast and Slow Thinking in your brain.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XWypLR&via=Digg&text=This Is How Your Brain Works

div.div: It costs millions to advertise during the Super Bowl. Which companies have spent their dollars most wisely? From Doritos to Budweiser, Betty White to John Stamos, we rank the winners.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WSNteI&via=Digg&text=20 Most Effective Super Bowl Ads

div.a: Is Your Mind For Sale? Inside The Allure Of Digital Sweatshops

div.div: Amazon's Mechanical Turk uses human intelligence to do the work that one day a computer might do. Amazingly, there are thousands of people who "turk," and these micro-laborers tend to turk for many hours often making only a penny per task.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U5GIK1&via=Digg&text=Is Your Mind For Sale? Inside The Allure Of Digital Sweatshops

div.a: Holding The Steering Wheel At 10 And 2 O'Clock Is No Longer Recommended

div.div: Forget everything you learned in driver's ed.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11lvJy0&via=Digg&text=Holding The Steering Wheel At 10 And 2 O'Clock Is No Longer Recommended

div.a: How Much Have Big Mac Prices Risen Or Fallen Across The World?

div.div: The Big Mac index was invented by The Economist in 1986 as a lighthearted guide to whether currencies are at their “correct” level.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XnLfE6&via=Digg&text=How Much Have Big Mac Prices Risen Or Fallen Across The World?

div.a: The Year I Spent As A Phone-Sex Operator

div.div: I lived in dread of mixing up my phone-sex job with my tech support job. While a sexy laugh and a description of my breasts might have gotten me good results from retirees who needed their televisions fixed, I couldn't imagine it going over well with my managers.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XkehV6&via=Digg&text=The Year I Spent As A Phone-Sex Operator

div.a: The Secrets Of Grand Central Station

div.div: Nearly 750,000 people pass through New York's Grand Central every day, making it one of the largest and busiest stations in the world. But even a place like Grand Central has its secrets.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/11o1CWL&via=Digg&text=The Secrets Of Grand Central Station

div.div: IS THAT AN O OR AN 0?

div.a: CAPTCHA May Finally Be Dying And That's Just Fine With Us

div.div: It will make a funny story for future generations, that for about a decade at the beginning of the century, we'd agreed as a society that the defining mark of our shared humanity was an ability to read bad handwriting.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XoSvPO&via=Digg&text=CAPTCHA May Finally Be Dying And That's Just Fine With Us

div.div: HOW THE WEST WAS ONES AND ZEROES

div.a: Is The New York Times Hacking Just The Beginning?

div.div: Hackers in China breached the paper’s computers for months. But even the security consultant who found the culprit says the West just doesn’t get the unbridled enemy it’s facing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/YHS88c&via=Digg&text=Is The New York Times Hacking Just The Beginning?
